items.title: US and Ukraine reach consensus on key issues to end war with Russia but territorial disputes remain
items.summary: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that Ukraine has reached consensus with the US on key issues to end the war with Russia but sensitive issues around territorial control, along with the management of a nuclear power plant, still remain unresolved.

items.title: Even in the markets, it's beginning to look like Christmas
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Cocos (Keeling) Islands residents bunker down as Tropical Cyclone Grant approaches
items.summary: Residents on a remote Indian Ocean territory are bunkering down and scrapping Christmas plans as Tropical Cyclone Grant approaches.

items.title: Bomb-making list, firearms, extremist flags seized from Perth man accused of backing Bondi attackers
items.summary: Police found a bomb-making shopping list when they searched the home of a man who allegedly posted on social media that he supported the gunmen behind the Bondi terror attack, a Perth court has heard.

items.title: Alice Springs veteran Geoffrey Shaw remembered as tireless advocate for Aboriginal rights
items.summary: Alice Springs war veteran Geoffrey Shaw OAM has been remembered as a tireless advocate for Indigenous rights in Central Australia, who leaves a legacy of courage and service.

items.title: Duress alarms given to councillors amid violent threats from public
items.summary: Duress alarms, often used by healthcare workers in high-risk settings, are being handed out by a regional Victorian council to boost elected representatives' safety.

items.title: England skipper Ben Stokes defends his team as Jofra Archer ruled out of Ashes
items.summary: England's disastrous Ashes tour has received another blow with Jofra Archer ruled out of the remaining two Tests while skipper Ben Stokes has dug in to defend his beleaguered team.

items.title: Concerns over abortion, vasectomies, IVF, gender-affirming care access as Catholic organisation Calvary buys Hobart Private
items.summary: The operator of the Hobart Private Hospital has agreed to sell the facility to Catholic healthcare provider Calvary, leading to concerns about access to surgical abortions, vasectomies and some other legal procedures.

items.title: $1.2 billion Hamilton Island deal sets precedent for Australian island resorts
items.summary: An American equity firm plans to purchase the jewel of the Whitsundays.

items.title: Man charged after weapons, detonators allegedly found at Dublin property
items.summary: A man has been charged after police allegedly seized explosive detonators and three unregistered firearms among other weapons from his property in Adelaide's north.

items.title: Woman charged over fatal stabbing of Zac McRae at Western Sydney bus station
items.summary: Emergency services were called to a bus station at Mount Druitt in August to find two 19-year-old men with stab wounds.

items.title: WA Police charge man over alleged antisemitic comments on social media
items.summary: A WA man's eligibility to hold a gun license will be reviewed after police charged him with allegedly posting antisemitic comments on social media.

items.title: Woman accused of 'repeatedly encouraging' partner to suicide granted bail
items.summary: An Adelaide woman accused of repeatedly encouraging her partner to take his own life has been granted home detention bail.

items.title: Young motorcyclist warns others after surviving high-speed crash
items.summary: Liam Ganter does not remember the crash that nearly killed him, but he is living with the consequences, and hopes his story will stop others making the same mistake.

items.title: Girl, 12, critical after being pulled from water at Trigg Beach in Perth's north
items.summary: A 12-year-old girl is in a critical condition after a surfer pulled her unresponsive from the water at Trigg Beach on Tuesday.

items.title: '$10,000 worth of Louis Vuitton' stolen in alleged home invasion at Old Beach, Tasmania
items.summary: Two armed offenders allegedly forced the occupant of a house north of Hobart to open a safe, escaping with about $10,000 worth of Louis Vuitton items, police say.

items.title: Sewage leak prompts Broadwater swimming warning ahead of Christmas
items.summary: Swimmers and boaties are being warned to avoid part of the Gold Coast Broadwater at Biggera Waters after a sewage leak just days out from Christmas.

items.title: Video purported to show Ben Duckett drunk in Noosa
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: England investigates Ben Duckett Noosa video as disastrous Ashes tour takes another turn
items.summary: A video said to feature Ben Duckett is under ECB investigation in another problem for England's disastrous Ashes tour.

items.title: 'Fake' letter and 'false claims' among latest Epstein files, US Justice Department says
items.summary: The US government says newly released documents from the Epstein files contain "untrue and sensationalist" claims about Donald Trump.

items.title: Sydney to Hobart yacht race not expecting repeat of last year's horrific conditions
items.summary: The Sydney to Hobart fleet is in for milder conditions this year than in 2024, when two people died on the first night of racing, although sailors have been warned to expect strong winds.

items.title: Tropical Cyclone Grant approaches Cocos (Keeling) Islands as severe Christmas heatwave scorches WA
items.summary: Preparations are underway far off Western Australia's north-west coast for the impact of a category one cyclone as Perth and much of the state continues to swelter in heatwave conditions.

items.title: Kate Winslet makes her directorial debut with family Christmas movie Goodbye June
items.summary: The actor talks about why she felt compelled to make the Christmas-themed film and why she was lucky to get Helen Mirren to play the titular role.

items.title: Through my eyes: Jean Mitchell
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: WA farming community loses 500 sheep, thousands of hectares of crops in fire
items.summary: A bushfire emergency in Warradarge is over, but farmers say the work to recover what was lost has only just begun.

items.title: Bondi terror attack heroes to be recognised in new honours list
items.summary: The prime minister announces those who showed "extraordinary" bravery during the Bondi terror attack will be recognised in a new honours list.

items.title: Convenience over tradition as gen Z and millennials favour pre-peeled prawns over the Christmas period
items.summary: New research shows younger Aussies prefer to save time and mess by buying pre-peeled prawns over the festive season.

items.title: Tarina Warren has been legally blind since she was 16, now a seeing eye dog is helping her navigate life on Moolooloo Station
items.summary: Moolooloo station, nestled in South Australia's Flinders Ranges, might look like your typical outback farm, but the workforce at this station has one unique addition — a black labrador called Mika.

items.title: Father of three meets bone marrow donor who saved his life for 'most special Christmas'
items.summary: Battling acute myeloid leukaemia, Gennaro Rapinese finally found a suitable bone marrow donor on the other side of the world in the US. And, after making a full recovery, he got to thank her in person in the lead-up to Christmas.

items.title: A US bone marrow donor is reunited with the Perth man she saved.
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Double-lung transplant recipient Johnnie Tumai's plea for Christmas organ donors
items.summary: Johnnie Tumai is preparing to spend his first Christmas at home since receiving a new set of lungs. He's urging others to register as donors this festive season.

items.title: Mohamed Salah claims Africa Cup of Nations record as Egypt beat Zimbabwe
items.summary: Mohamed Salah scored at his fifth Africa Cup of Nations tournament in a row, becoming the first Egyptian player to do so.

items.title: Woman's miraculous Arnhem Land survival story after ankle 'snapped in half'
items.summary: Lying on the ground with her ankle snapped in half in the remote bushland of western Arnhem Land, her mind racing, and with no help or phone reception, Margie Moroney began to crawl.

items.title: Australian dollar jumps to 14-month high, ASX falls as gold and silver hit record highs — as it happened
items.summary: The Australian share market is down on Christmas Eve, despite the value of US stocks, gold and silver climbing to their most expensive levels ever, while the Australian dollar has jumped to its highest level since October 2024.

items.title: Runner Nancy Dickman, 83, prepares for her next marathon at 90
items.summary: Nancy Dickman has run marathons in London, New York, Rome and Sydney, and at 83 shows no signs of slowing down.

items.title: Rain on Queensland's Christmas forecast, north-west on flood watch
items.summary: It may not be the most welcome weather at the beach, but out in the west, rain is the best Christmas gift.

items.title: A $7m unpaid tobacco fine and online sales emerge amid government crack down on illegal trade
items.summary: Illicit tobacco retailers have racked up millions in unpaid fines since the introduction of stronger penalties, with one owing more than $7 million.

items.title: Australian businessman Ranjit Thambyrajah languishes in Vietnam jail after string of failed loan deals
items.summary: A high-flying Australian financier accused of swindling a struggling Vietnamese petroleum trading company has been languishing in a Ho Chi Minh City cell for two months.

items.title: Boxing Day sales set to be biggest on record as interest rate relief drives retail rebound
items.summary: Boxing Day spending is expected to hit a record high, supported by revived household spending after three interest rate cuts.

items.title: Do you know how to make the gravy? Test your Christmas song knowledge
items.summary: Which Christmas hits didn't do as well on the charts as you'd think? Test your knowledge of festive cheer.

items.title: Cooler spring blamed for Tasmania's later Christmas berry, cherry harvest
items.summary: Christmas is usually a boom time for Tasmanian berry producers, but this year's cold spring has slowed crops and hurt profits.

items.title: US approves Wegovy pill, giving Novo Nordisk an edge in obesity drug competition
items.summary: A daily weight-loss pill will soon be available in the US, after the regulator gave approval to Danish drug company Novo Nordisk's oral version of the popular injectable, Wegovy.

items.title: Adelaide academic accused of attempting to kill her ex searched methods to kill, court hears
items.summary: A woman accused of trying to murder her ex-husband before fleeing to Palau has made a bid in South Australia's Supreme Court for release on bail.

items.title: Aboriginal legal aid lawyers launch High Court challenge to NT bail laws
items.summary: The North Australian Aboriginal Justice Agency says hundreds of people are likely being held on remand in Northern Territory jails "unlawfully and unconstitutionally".

items.title: Robert Donald Blackberry jailed after hay bale scam targeting Tasmanian farmers
items.summary: A judge blasts a man's "complete and utter disregard for the law" and jails him for scamming farmers desperate for feed out of money for hay bales he never delivered.

items.title: Woman treated for suspected bite after eastern brown snake became trapped in her shoe
items.summary: A woman has been rushed to hospital after a brown snake curled around her leg, becoming trapped in her shoe.

items.title: CommBank reverses refusal to refund $68m in excessive fees for low-income earners
items.summary: The Commonwealth Bank of Australia will refund low-income earners receiving Centrelink payments approximately $68 million in unfair fees — just over a quarter of what was charged.

items.title: Up to 1,700 jobs axed days out from Christmas as security firm MA Services collapses
items.summary: A "significant number" of employees have been made immediately redundant as MA Security — which provides security and maintenance services to major retailers like Coles, Kmart and Amazon — enters administration.

items.title: Delta Electricity found guilty over 2022 fish kill near its Vales Point Power Station
items.summary: A court rules a maintenance failure caused hundreds of fish to die near Delta Electricity's Vales Point coal-fired power station in September 2022, a month after another kill triggered by natural causes.

items.title: NSW police officer Jack Hibbert released from hospital after being shot in Bondi terror attack
items.summary: A young police officer who was rendered blind in one eye after being shot during the Bondi terror attack is released from hospital.

items.title: Pat Cummins could miss T20 World Cup to manage back injury
items.summary: Pat Cummins could be held back from the upcoming T20 World Cup as Australia look to manage his workload following his recent back injury.

items.title: ECB managing director Rob Key to investigate England's Noosa break following Ashes failure
items.summary: ECB managing director Rob Key will investigate reports England's recent break in Noosa resembled a "stag do" as the tourists pick up the pieces from their Ashes defeat.

items.title: NSW oyster growers face contrasting holiday seasons as Christmas Eve rush looms
items.summary: The Christmas oyster harvest is flourishing on the NSW south coast, but further north it is a very different story as growers face the fallout of this year's record-breaking floods.

items.title: Canterbury-Bankstown Council shuts down prayer hall linked to notorious preacher Wisam Haddad
items.summary: The City of Canterbury Bankstown Council says the site had been approved for use as a medical centre.

items.title: Therapeutic Goods Administration issues warnings over heavy metals in Ayurvedic tablets
items.summary: Australia's medicine watchdog has issued another safety alert for contaminated Ayurvedic medicines. So what do consumers need to know about this multi-million-dollar industry?

items.title: No air conditioning in Shellharbour Hospital ward during heatwave
items.summary: Patients swelter in an Illawarra hospital ward after an air conditioning unit fails during a heatwave.

items.title: As a newly single mum, I am redefining Christmas with my kids
items.summary: This is my first Christmas as a single mum where I will wake up without my son in the home. I won't be watching him excitedly tear into presents. It's not easy, but there's also some relief, writes Catherine.

items.title: Best podcasts of 2025, from Forged to Fela Kuti: Fear No Man
items.summary: Our favourite podcasts of the year include tales of art forgery, a documentary about the life of Fela Kútì and a true-crime thriller about a dead body in the ocean.

items.title: Gregory John Walker jailed over Arthur Haines' death after 1998 Sydney firebombing
items.summary: Gregory John Walker is sentenced to at least six-and-a-half years in prison for unlawfully killing a teenager by firebombing a Sydney home in 1998 during an escalating neighbourhood dispute.

items.title: Koala protection in south-east Queensland to be shaped by new strategy
items.summary: The Queensland government is inviting the public to have their say on a new strategy to protect the south-east's koala population.
